name: AI-based PRD Reviewer
description: AI tool for PRD analysis, grading, and actionable feedback.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: Our AI-based PRD Reviewer helps product managers ensure their Product Requirements Documents are clear, complete, and aligned with best practices. By analyzing and grading PRD content, we provide actionable feedback, saving time and significantly improving the quality and effectiveness of product development.
current_prd.problem_statement: Product managers often struggle to create high-quality Product Requirements Documents (PRDs) that are clear, complete, and adhere to best practices. This leads to miscommunication, scope creep, development delays, and ultimately, products that don't meet market needs or stakeholder expectations. Manual review processes are time-consuming, inconsistent, and prone to human error, making it difficult to ensure PRD quality at scale.
current_prd.solution: The AI-based PRD Reviewer addresses this by providing an automated, intelligent solution for PRD analysis. Users can upload or paste their PRDs, which are then processed by an AI model trained on best practices in product management. The tool generates a comprehensive grade, identifies areas for improvement, and offers specific, actionable feedback to enhance clarity, completeness, and strategic alignment. This streamlines the review process, ensures consistent quality, and empowers product managers to create superior PRDs more efficiently.

key_features.feature_description: Allows users to upload PRD documents (e.g., PDF, DOCX) or paste text directly into the tool for analysis.
An AI model analyzes the PRD content against predefined criteria for clarity, completeness, consistency, and adherence to product management best practices.
Generates an overall quality score or grade for the PRD, along with scores for specific sections (e.g., problem statement, solution, features).
Provides specific, actionable recommendations for improving the PRD, highlighting areas that need more detail, clarification, or restructuring.
Allows users to customize the review criteria and best practices against which their PRDs are evaluated.
Stores past PRD reviews and feedback, enabling users to track improvements over time and maintain a history of document iterations.
Integrates with popular document management systems (e.g., Confluence, Google Docs) for seamless PRD import and export.
A dashboard for administrators to manage user accounts, review criteria, and monitor system performance and usage.
Tracks user activity, PRD review metrics, and system performance to identify trends and areas for improvement.
Tools and processes for deploying updates, maintaining system health, and providing technical support.

steps: User navigates to the PRD Reviewer tool.
User selects 'Upload Document' or 'Paste Text' option.
User uploads a PRD file or pastes PRD content into the input field.
System processes the PRD using AI analysis.
System generates a PRD grade and actionable feedback.
System displays the review results to the user.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin adds new criteria, modifies existing ones, or deletes outdated criteria.
Admin saves changes to the review criteria.
System updates the AI model's review parameters.
Monitoring system collects data on API response times, AI model processing duration, and error rates.
System logs performance metrics to a central analytics platform.
Alerts are triggered if performance thresholds are exceeded.
Technical operations team investigates and resolves performance issues.
System generates reports on overall system health and uptime.

current_prd.success_metrics: Increase PRD quality scores by an average of 20% within 6 months of adoption. Achieve a 90% user satisfaction rate with the feedback provided. Reduce PRD review cycle time by 30% for product teams. Attain 70% user retention rate after the first month.
current_prd.competitors: Manual PRD review processes, general AI writing assistants (e.g., ChatGPT, Bard), specialized document analysis tools (e.g., Grammarly Business, Writer), product management platforms with built-in document features (e.g., Aha!, Productboard).
current_prd.vision: To become the industry standard for PRD quality assurance, enabling product teams worldwide to consistently deliver exceptional products by ensuring their foundational documentation is flawless, clear, and strategically sound.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the fundamental functionality of the AI-based PRD Reviewer. Users can input their PRDs, receive an AI-driven analysis, a quality grade, and specific feedback. This core set of features is sufficient for a compelling demonstration to stakeholders and can serve as a minimal viable product (MVP) to validate the core value proposition with early users.

Building on the MVP, this phase introduces features that significantly enhance the user experience and utility. Customizable review criteria allow users to tailor the AI's evaluation to their specific needs, while review history and version control enable tracking of PRD improvements over time. This makes the tool more robust and valuable for ongoing product development, suitable for a beta launch to a wider audience.

This final phase focuses on preparing the product for broader adoption, enterprise use, and long-term operational stability. The API enables seamless integration with existing document management systems, crucial for enterprise environments. The Admin Dashboard, Analytics and Monitoring, and Technical Operations & Support features provide the necessary tools for managing users, tracking performance, and ensuring the system's health and scalability for a full commercial launch or comprehensive enterprise demonstration.
phasing.phase_name: Enterprise & Operational Readiness (Full Launch / Enterprise Demo)

current_prd.design_principles:
1. Clarity & Simplicity: The user interface should be intuitive, easy to understand, and minimize cognitive load, allowing users to focus on the PRD content and feedback.
2. Actionable Feedback: Design should prioritize the clear presentation of AI-generated feedback and recommendations, making it easy for users to understand and act upon.
3. Efficiency: Streamlined workflows and quick access to core functionalities to ensure product managers can review PRDs efficiently and save time.
4. Trust & Reliability: Visual design and information architecture should convey the accuracy and trustworthiness of the AI analysis and grading.
5. Customizability: Provide clear and accessible options for users (especially administrators) to customize review criteria and settings.

planned.model_content:
class Prd < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :reviews, dependent: :destroy

  validates :title, presence: true
  validates :content, presence: true

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization, :user]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreatePrds < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :prds do |t|
      t.string :title, null: false
      t.text :content, null: false
      t.datetime :upload_timestamp, null: false, default: -> { 'CURRENT_TIMESTAMP' }
      t.references :user, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
